rooms.Name: On to Caemlyn, Perrins Camp
rooms.Description:
Hunger, fear, and weariness plague every movement in your body.  Will you
ever get to Caemlyn?  There hasnt even been a farmhouse in the distance for
days.  Every day wolves follow you, and every night they circle you like
vultures waiting for you to drop dead.  Here, Perrin and Egwene made a small
encampment to rest in during their journey.  The ashes look pretty fresh.

rooms.Name: On to Caemlyn, Elyass Encampment
rooms.Description:
After several more days of walking you come upon the heavenly smell of
roasting rabbit and wood smoke.  As you get nearer to the smell you see that
a strange man has erected a encampment here.  Slowly, and cautiously you walk
towards then encampment, only to hear, "Are you going to stand there drooling
in the underbrush or are you going to come introduce yourself and eat some
rabbit meat."  Thus you have your first meeting with Elyas Machera.

rooms.Name: On to Caemlyn, Running with the wolves
rooms.Description:
After a long, friendly talk with Elyas you are now back on track for Caemlyn.
Armed with newfound understanding, you welcome the company of Dapple and his
pack mates. With the aid of Elyas and the wolves you make excellent time.
After 5 days of traveling you can see a group of the Traveling people in the
distance.

rooms.Name: On to Caemlyn, The Traveling People
rooms.Description:
With the guide of Dapple, Hopper and Wind you have made the hard trek through
the Forest in good time. After days of walking you come upon a long train of
wagons. On close inspection you see that the wagons are little more then
houses on wheels.  The color of the houses are only slightly dulled by the
brightly colored clothes of the occupants. Smells of cooking food, and the
sound of merry fiddle music overcome your senses and you long for home.

rooms.Name: Traveling People, Middle of Camp
rooms.Description:
Laughter, good food, and happy people surround you.  As you stroll about the
center of the Mahdi camp you can't help but pick up the lengend of the
people. It is said that the Mahdi shall travel the world, looking for a
special song.  When the Mahdi find the song the paradise of the Age of
Legends will return. The Mahdi are a cheery and non-violent people.  To the
north you see the Seeker's wagon.

rooms.Name: Traveling People, Seekers Wagon
rooms.Description:
Bright colors cover the wagon like much of the rest of the camp.  This wagon
is home to the leader Raen, and his wife Ila.  It is obvious that no warrior
has ever inhabited this place. A small table holds a loot, that looks well
played.

ExtraDescs.Description: It looks like even the leader of the Mahdi is a bard at heart.

rooms.Name: Traveling People, Around the cook fire
rooms.Description:
Here Mahdi and visitors have formed a circle, and are passing out the daily
meal.  The dinner looks to be a tasty stew with bread on the side.  As people
finish their meal some pick up instruments and play a merry tune, which the
younger people dance to. Slightly to your north, a group of the Mahdi dances.
A trail here forks away from the camp to the east, into the wilderness.

rooms.Name: Traveling People, Dancing
rooms.Description:
Groups of Mahdi dance in joyful circles around a medium sized group of
musicians.  You hear many popular songs being played on a wide assortment of
instruments.   Among the tunes being played you hear, "Pretty Maids Dancing",
"Toss the Feathers", and "Hard Rain falling."  As you sit and listen to the
music you can almost swear you hear a bit of electric guitar music very odd,
as there is no electricity.

rooms.Name: On to Camelyn, just past the Mahdi Camp
rooms.Description:
As you journey away from the camp you hear the words of the seeker saying,
"As you came in peace, Depart now in peace.  Always will out fires welcome
you, in peace. The Way of the Leaf is peace." You return the reply with,
"Peace be on you always, and all the People.  I will find the song, or
another will find the song, but the song will be sung, this year or the year
to come.  As it once was, so shall it be again, world without end. "  As you
finally leave the camp, you journey into a dry grassland.  The grassland
continues to the south.

rooms.Name: On to Camelyn, before a ridge
rooms.Description:
After days of travel the grassland becomes more hilly.  Here and there very
small thickets of hardy trees and thorn bushes cover the land providing the
only vegitation, aside from sparse patches of brown winter grass. As you
finally take a moment to rest you come to a large ridge, too big to circle
around.  Luckily, the ridge looks climbable, and you can continue up and
climb it.

rooms.Name: On to Camelyn, top of the ridge
rooms.Description:
You creep slowly up the ridge, and rightly too, because in the distance you
see a huge flock of jet-black ravens roosting in a large tree.  While
normally the easiest of the dark ones troops to kill, a huge flock or ravens
can pick a human clean in a matter of seconds.   It looks like you should be
able to pick your way boulder to boulder, to the south.

rooms.Name: On to Caemlyn, Dangerous Area #1
rooms.Description:
As you pick your way from boulder to boulder you can't help but shiver in
terror at the ravens.  Evidence of their passing is clear, as you walk
through piles of bloody animal fragmants at every other step. To the north a
huge flock of ravens is tearing apart an animal, and to the northwest you see
a stedding.

rooms.Name: On to Caemlyn, A stedding
rooms.Description:
Description: As you enter the stedding, a ripple of coldness sweeps through
your body as if you had jumped into a river in mid-winter.  Built by the
Ogier, the stedding provides the one thing you need right now, safety.
Steddings are sort of a safety area that the Ogier used for their homes.  No
evil, and no magic may exist inside of a stedding.  This stedding seems to
have served some grand purpose in some ancient time. A huge piece of
stonework is to the north.

rooms.Name: Surrounded by Ravens
rooms.Description:
Here the sky is thick and black with ravens.  Blood red beady eyes gaze at
you with violence.  I hope your flesh is made of stone, because if not you
are about to have it ripped from your bones. Good luck, you'll need it.

rooms.Name: Arthur Hawking's Hand
rooms.Description:
In times long past, a huge statue of Arthur Hawking was built here, but it
has long been torn to pieces.   It looks like a fight was fought here very
recently. The bodies of several White Cloaks, and a wolf lie here in a pool
of blood.  One of the White Cloaks has huge gashes from an axe, maybe Perrin
was here? Far to the east you see a camp of the Children of the Light.
